Source code for bi_etl.memory_size

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
'''
Created on Jan 12, 2016

@author: woodd
'''
import gc
import sys
import os
from copy import copy


[docs]def get_size_gc(obj, depth_limit=10, depth=0, procssed_objects=None, processed_classes=None, ref_chain= None):
    '''
    For debugging only!  This function is very slow. 10,000 cells (rows * columns) takes 1 second.
    '''
    if procssed_objects is None:
        procssed_objects = set()
    if id(obj) in procssed_objects:
        return 0
    type_name = str(type(obj))
    if type_name in ["<class 'function'>",
                     "<class 'property'>",                      
                     "<class 'staticmethod'>",
                     "<class 'module'>",
                     "<class 'classmethod'>",
                     "<class 'ipykernel.iostream.OutStream'>",
                     "<class 'IPython.core.completer.IPCompleter'>",
                     ]:
        return 0
    procssed_objects.add(id(obj))
    size = sys.getsizeof(obj) 
    if processed_classes is not None:
        if ref_chain is None:
            ref_chain = [type_name]
        else:
            ref_chain.append(type_name)
        d = processed_classes.get(type_name,{'cnt':0, 'size':0, 'max_depth':0})
        d['cnt'] += 1
        d['size'] += size
        if depth > d.get('max_depth',0): 
            d['max_depth'] = depth
            d['ref_chain'] = copy(ref_chain)
        processed_classes[type_name] = d
    for chld in gc.get_referents(obj):
        size += get_size_gc(chld, depth_limit=depth_limit, depth= depth+1, procssed_objects=procssed_objects, processed_classes=processed_classes, ref_chain=ref_chain)
    if ref_chain is not None:
        ref_chain.pop()
    return size  



[docs]def sort_key(item):
    return item[1]['size']



[docs]def get_size_summary(obj, print_summary=True):
    procssed_objects = set()
    processed_classes = dict()    
    
    sz=get_size_gc(obj, procssed_objects=procssed_objects, processed_classes=processed_classes)
    if print_summary:
        for cls, data in sorted(processed_classes.items(), key=sort_key):
            print('{} size = {data[size]:,} cnt= {data[cnt]:,} max_depth={data[max_depth]}'.format(cls,data=data))
            print('\t ref_chain={}'.format(data.get('ref_chain',None)))
            print()
        print('size={:,}'.format(sz))    
    return sz



[docs]def get_dir_size(path):
    total_size = 0
    if os.path.isfile(path):
        total_size = os.path.getsize(path)
    else:
        for dirpath, _, filenames in os.walk(path):
            for f in filenames:
                fp = os.path.join(dirpath, f)
                total_size += os.path.getsize(fp)
    return total_size
